intro: Monostiche daniellii, commonly known as the Danell's monostich, is a rare and delicate plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of the carrot family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
